messages.title: A record of action. A promise of more.
messages.content: With your support on June 8th, Julian will: Oppose Brexit and fight to protect local jobs by keeping Britain in the single market, reverse cuts to schools and invest £7 billion to ensure no local schools lose teachers or teaching assistants, use a 1p increase on income tax to inject £6 billion a year into our NHS & social care, especially mental health.

messages.title: Called to see you
messages.content: As our MP Julian gained a reputation for standing up for Cambridge residents and providing us with the strong voice we need on the issues that matter most.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Oppose Brexit and fight to protect local jobs by keeping Britain in the single market.
Reverse cuts to schools and invest £7 billion to ensure no local schools lose teachers or teaching assistants.
Use a 1p increase on income tax to inject £6 billion a year into our NHS & social care, especially mental health.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet mentions that 'It's Julian or Labour - The Conservatives can't win' in the context of historical voting patterns and strategic considerations, indicating a tactical voting situation.

issues.brexitEurope: Oppose Brexit and fight to protect local jobs by keeping Britain in the single market.
issues.education: Reverse cuts to schools and invest £7 billion to ensure no local schools lose teachers or teaching assistants.
issues.health: Use a 1p increase on income tax to inject £6 billion a year into our NHS & social care, especially mental health.

leaflet.personalStatement: Julian grew up and lives here in Cambridge. He knows our city and the challenges we all face well.

politicalExperience.achievements: Gained a reputation for standing up for Cambridge residents, providing a strong voice on the issues that mattered most, helped to deliver an extra £20 million schools and health services, and delivered the new Cambridge North station and Chisholm Trail cycle route.

contactInformation.address: 15 Ronald Rolph Court, Wadloes Road, Cambridge CB5 8PX

images.caption: Julian Huppert with residents, Julian Huppert in discussion

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet is targeted towards tactical voting, emphasizing Julian Huppert as the primary opposition to Labour, with the Conservatives unable to win.
